diseases.name: malaria
symptoms: High fever
Shaking chills
Headache
Muscle aches
Fatigue
Nausea and vomiting
Recurrent fevers that come and go in cycles
prevention: Apply mosquito repellent to exposed skin.
Wear long-sleeved clothing, especially at dusk and dawn.
Eliminate standing water around your home where mosquitoes breed.

diseases.name: dengue
symptoms: High fever (104°F or 40°C)
Severe headache
Pain behind the eyes
Severe joint and muscle pain, like bones are breaking
Rash
Mild bleeding (such as nose bleed, bleeding gums, or easy bruising)
prevention: Prevent mosquito bites by using repellent and wearing protective clothing.
Keep surroundings clean and free of stagnant water to prevent mosquito breeding.
Use mosquito nets and window screens.

diseases.name: typhoid
symptoms: Sustained high fever that rises gradually
Weakness
Stomach pain
Headache
Loss of appetite
Sometimes a rash of flat, rose-colored spots
Constipation or diarrhea sometimes
prevention: Ensure drinking water is safe (boiled or purified).
Wash hands thoroughly with soap, especially after using the toilet and before eating.
Avoid eating raw or undercooked food.

diseases.name: covid-19
symptoms: Fever or chills
Cough
Shortness of breath or difficulty breathing
Fatigue
Muscle or body aches
Loss of taste or smell
Sore throat
prevention: Get vaccinated and stay up to date with booster shots.
Wash hands frequently with soap and water or use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
Wear a well-fitting mask in crowded areas.
Ensure good ventilation in indoor spaces.

diseases.name: heart attack
symptoms: A heavy or squeezing pain in the chest, especially when walking or climbing stairs
Pain spreads to my left arm, neck, or jaw
Shortness of breath even with little effort
Unusually tired and dizzy

diseases.name: stroke
symptoms: Face suddenly drooped on one side
Can’t lift one arm properly
Speech suddenly became slurred or couldn’t talk
Sudden loss of vision or balance

diseases.name: copd
symptoms: Cough every day and bring up thick phlegm
Feel breathless while climbing stairs or walking
Hear a whistling or wheezing sound when breathing
Often get chest infections

diseases.name: pneumonia
symptoms: Fever with chills and body pain
Cough brings up yellow or green phlegm
Feel chest pain when breathing or coughing
Get tired easily and feel weak
prevention: Drink warm fluids, rest, steam inhalation.

diseases.name: diabetes
symptoms: Feel thirsty all the time and pass urine very frequently
Feel hungry often but still lose weight
Vision gets blurry sometimes
Small wounds take longer to heal

diseases.name: alzheimer's
symptoms: Forget names and recent events often
Get confused about places or dates
Lose track of conversations or repeat the same questions
Struggle with daily activities like cooking or handling money
prevention: Do puzzles, read, and keep brain active
Exercise regularly, eat brain-healthy foods (fish, nuts)

diseases.name: jaundice
symptoms: Eyes and skin are yellowish
Feel very tired and my urine is dark
Have mild fever, nausea, and loss of appetite
prevention: Get vaccinated for Hepatitis A and B.

diseases.name: chikungunya
symptoms: Sudden fever with severe joint pain, especially in fingers, wrists, knees
Feel tired and sometimes have rashes on skin

diseases.name: asthma
symptoms: Feel tightness in my chest
Get wheezing or whistling sounds when I breathe
Cough a lot, especially at night or early morning
Shortness of breath during exercise or exposure to dust/pollen
prevention: Avoid triggers like dust, smoke, and pollution

diseases.name: arthritis
symptoms: Joints feel stiff and painful, especially in the morning
Swelling around my knees, hands, or wrists
It’s harder to move joints or walk long distances

diseases.name: tuberculosis
symptoms: A cough that lasts for more than 2 weeks
Coughing up blood or mucus
Sweating at night and having a fever
Losing weight without trying
prevention: Get the BCG vaccination, especially for children.
Cover your mouth when coughing or sneezing.
Ensure good ventilation and sunlight in rooms.

diseases.name: hypertension
symptoms: Often get headaches, especially at the back of the head
Feeling dizzy or having blurry vision sometimes
Feeling your heart pounding in your chest
Chest discomfort
prevention: Manage stress through activities like yoga or meditation

diseases.name: kidney disease
symptoms: Feeling tired all the time
Swelling in feet, hands, or face
Feeling itchy and sometimes urinating less
Foamy urine
prevention: Stay hydrated by drinking enough water
Keep blood pressure and blood sugar under control

diseases.name: gastroenteritis
symptoms: Diarrhea with stomach cramps
Feeling nauseous or vomiting
Feeling weak and thirsty
Sometimes a low-grade fever
prevention: Get the Rotavirus vaccine for infants.
Drink Oral Rehydration Solution (ORS) to stay hydrated.
Avoid street food and contaminated water.

diseases.name: common cold
symptoms: Runny or stuffy nose
Sore or scratchy throat
Cough and sneezing
Slight body aches or a mild headache
prevention: Wash your hands often with soap and water
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, or mouth with unwashed hands
Get plenty of rest and eat well

diseases.name: conjunctivitis
symptoms: Redness in one or both eyes
Itchiness and a gritty feeling in the eye
A discharge that forms a crust during the night
Tearing and sensitivity to light
prevention: Don't touch your eyes with your hands
Use a clean towel and washcloth daily
Don't share eye cosmetics or personal eye care items

vaccinations.name: opv
vaccinations.schedule: At birth (0 dose), then at 6, 10, and 14 weeks

vaccinations.name: measles
vaccinations.schedule: First dose at 9-12 months, second dose at 16-24 months
